summary: State-reported data help the federal government oversee the Medicaid program, which made an estimated $36.7 billion in payment errors in 2017. However, there have been longstanding concerns that those data are not sufficient for effective oversight. To help, federal administrators established a new data repository. Nearly all states now submit data that could be used to improve oversight and program management. However, concerns persist over...
title: Medicaid: Further Action Needed to Expedite Use of National Data for Program Oversight
